channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Bats catch a lift from storm winds on long-distance migrations
item.description: Migrating hundreds and hundreds of miles is hard work for the common noctule bat. But this European species makes its marathon journey a little bit easier by paying attention to the weather.
item.content:encoded:
Migrating hundreds and hundreds of miles is hard work for the common noctule bat. But this European species makes its marathon journey a little bit easier by paying attention to the weather.

(Image credit: Kamran Safi)
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Lambert

item.title: Biden awards Medal of Freedom to Hillary Clinton, Soros, Messi and 16 others
item.description: Biden will also posthumously grant the medal to former U.S. Attorney General Robert F. Kennedy and former Michigan Gov. George Romney.
item.content:encoded:
Biden will also posthumously grant the medal to former U.S. Attorney General Robert F. Kennedy and former Michigan Gov. George Romney.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordo√±ez

item.title: Seeking to heal the country, Jimmy Carter pardoned men who evaded the Vietnam War draft
item.description: The pardon was one of the defining presidential moments for Jimmy Carter, who died Dec. 29 at the age of 100. The move was pilloried by members of the military and conservative politicians.
item.content:encoded: The pardon was one of the defining presidential moments for Jimmy Carter, who died Dec. 29 at the age of 100. The move was pilloried by members of the military and conservative politicians.
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Funeral services for former President Jimmy Carter start today in Georgia
item.description: The first day of memorial services for former President Jimmy Carter begins today in his hometown of Plains, Ga., and will include stops at the Georgia State Capitol and the Carter Center in Atlanta.
item.content:encoded:
The first day of memorial services for former President Jimmy Carter begins today in his hometown of Plains, Ga., and will include stops at the Georgia State Capitol and the Carter Center in Atlanta.

(Image credit: Alex Wroblewski)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: 5 financial habits to leave behind for a more prosperous new year
item.description: As we say goodbye to 2024, let's also bid farewell to some less-than-ideal money habits: impulse purchases, out-of-control credit card debt and the trap of lifestyle creep.
item.content:encoded:
As we say goodbye to 2024, let's also bid farewell to some less-than-ideal money habits: impulse purchases, out-of-control credit card debt and the trap of lifestyle creep.

(Image credit: PM Images)
item.dc:creator: Marielle Segarra

item.title: Japanese woman who was the world's oldest person at 116 has died
item.description: Tomiko Itooka, a Japanese woman who was the world's oldest person according to Guinness World Records, has died, an Ashiya city official said Saturday. She was 116.
item.content:encoded:
Tomiko Itooka, a Japanese woman who was the world's oldest person according to Guinness World Records, has died, an Ashiya city official said Saturday. She was 116.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Net neutrality is struck, ending a long battle to regulate ISPs like public utilities
item.description: A U.S. Court of Appeals this week ruled that the FCC did not have legal authority to revive the so-called net neutrality rules that were first introduced a decade ago under the Obama Administration.
item.content:encoded:
A U.S. Court of Appeals this week ruled that the FCC did not have legal authority to revive the so-called net neutrality rules that were first introduced a decade ago under the Obama Administration.

(Image credit: Jacquelyn Martin/AP)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: The soldier who died in Cybertruck explosion wrote it was intended as a 'wakeup call'
item.description: Matthew Livelsberger, a 37-year-old Green Beret from Colorado, also wrote in a note that he needed to "cleanse my mind" of the lives lost of people he knew and "the burden of the lives I took."
item.content:encoded:
Matthew Livelsberger, a 37-year-old Green Beret from Colorado, also wrote in a note that he needed to "cleanse my mind" of the lives lost of people he knew and "the burden of the lives I took."

(Image credit: Bizuayehu Tesfaye)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump will be sentenced Jan. 10 in New York case, days before his inauguration
item.description: In a decision Friday, New York Judge Juan Merchan noted that his inclination was to not impose a sentence of incarceration.
item.content:encoded:
In a decision Friday, New York Judge Juan Merchan noted that his inclination was to not impose a sentence of incarceration.

(Image credit: Rebecca Noble)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: The attack in New Orleans reveals ISIS' influence lingers, experts say
item.description: The man behind the New Year's Day attack in New Orleans said in videos that he was inspired by ISIS and had joined the group this summer. This attack shows ISIS' resonance and resilience persists.
item.content:encoded:
The man behind the New Year's Day attack in New Orleans said in videos that he was inspired by ISIS and had joined the group this summer. This attack shows ISIS' resonance and resilience persists.

(Image credit: STR)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz
